snippet: While President Obama is widely seen as a friend of the tech industry, and has gotten far more donations, the excitement of his 2008 campaign has ebbed among investors and executives.
abstract: Pres Obama is widely seen as a friend of the Silicon Valley tech industry, and has gotten far more donations than Mitt Romney, but excitement of his 2008 campaign has ebbed among investors and executives; Romney has raised $2.04 million from the industry through August, and received contributions from former Obama donors who find his business background appealing.
lead_paragraph: While President Obama is widely seen as a friend of the tech industry, and has gotten far more donations, the excitement of his 2008 campaign has ebbed among investors and executives.

headline.seo: Some Tech Industry Donors Warm Up to Mitt Romney
headline.main: Romney and G.O.P. Make Inroads in Silicon Valley
headline.print_headline: Tech Donors Warm Up To Romney And G.O.P.
